exchanges.description: Transport of ammonia to the field, resulting from fertilizer replaced b/c of stover removal. Assuming 80.6km roundtrip distance.

exchanges.description: Anhydrous ammonia, 82% N. Avg US rate = 155 kg N per ha. Accounts for 47% of all N applied to corn in the US. IFA 2008. Accounts for additional fertilizers added b/c of stover removal. Nutrient replacement is based on ISU Extension publication PM-1688.  Proxy:  Ammonia, liquid, at regional storehouse/RER with US electricity U

flow.name: Ammonia, steam reforming, liquid, at plant
flow.category: Technosphere Flows/31-33: Manufacturing/3253: Pesticide, Fertilizer, and Other Agricultural Chemical Manufacturing

defaultProvider.category: 31-33: Manufacturing/3253: Pesticide, Fertilizer, and Other Agricultural Chemical Manufacturing

exchanges.description: Muriate of potash-K2O=60%. 100% of K applied to corn in 2007 was muriate. IFA 2008. Accounts for additional fertilizers added b/c of stover removal. Nutrient replacement is based on ISU Extension publication PM-1688, Table 2

flow.name: Potassium chloride, as K2O, at regional storehouse

exchanges.description: TSP = 48% P2O5. Assuming 20% of P2O5 applied to corn in 2007 was TSP. Accounts for additional fertilizers added b/c of stover removal. Nutrient replacement is based on ISU Extension publication PM-1688, Table 2. Proxy:  Triple superphosphate, as P2O5, at regional storehouse/RER with US electricity U

flow.name: Phosphorous fertilizer, production mix, at plant
flow.category: Technosphere Flows/31-33: Manufacturing/3253: Pesticide, Fertilizer, and Other Agricultural Chemical Manufacturing

defaultProvider.name: Phosphorous fertilizer, production mix, at plant
defaultProvider.category: 31-33: Manufacturing/3253: Pesticide, Fertilizer, and Other Agricultural Chemical Manufacturing

exchanges.description: Assuming 10% of N applied volatalizes to NH3. IPCC 2006: Chapter 11: N2O Emissions from Managed Soils, and CO2 Emissions from Lime and Urea Application. Table 11.3

UAN 32%. Avg US N rate = 155 kg N per hectare. 3.13 kg UAN 32 has 1 kg N. Accounts for 27% of all N applied to corn in the US. IFA 2008. Accounts for additional fertilizers added b/c of stover removal. Nutrient replacement is based on ISU Extension publication PM-1688. Proxy:  Urea ammonium nitrate, as N, at regional storehouse/RER with US electricity U

exchanges.description: Assuming 1.25% of N applied is lost via denitrification as N2O. IPCC 2006: Chapter 11: N2O Emissions from Managed Soils, and CO2 Emissions from Lime and Urea Application. Table 11.1; footnote 8. Teir I estimate.
